messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Yamaguchi Jiro (Saitou Hajime) and Saigo Tanomo
messages.msgSnippet: ... Never mind, I found it.  (It s message number 271 at the above address if anyone else wants to check the original.)  The last sentence, about the family
messages.messageBody:
> > Below is a post from
> > http://hajime3.hp.infoseek.co.jp/cgi-bin/bbs_06/bbs_06.cgi
> ......
>
> > ***If someone would like to try giving us a clear translation
> > please post (^_^)
>
> I might be able to give it a try if I could find the original post. Do
> you know the message number?

Never mind, I found it. (It's message number 271 at the above address if
anyone else wants to check the original.) The last sentence, about the
family relationships, was confusing and I'm not sure I translated that part
correctly, but I think the rest of it is right. Anyway, here's what I came
up with as a translation:

---------------------

Actually, after he repelled the first attack of the western campaign,
Yamaguchi Jirou (Saitou Hajime) requested a placement in a reconnaissance
unit outside the castle, but Saigou Tanomo didn't permit it and removed him
from the front lines.

Immediately after that, the western campaign broke through the Shirasaka
gateway, which the Shinsengumi had originally been protecting.

It's a very delicate issue whether it should be called lucky or should be
called a mistake to have taken such a true battle experienced person from
the scene.

Incidentally, Saigou Tanomo becomes an uncle to Fujita Tokio by her cousin
Kazuo's adoptive father (Numazawa Shichirou).

----------------------

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Yamaguchi Jiro (Saitou Hajime) and Saigo Tanomo
messages.msgSnippet: ... I might be able to give it a try if I could find the original post.  Do you know the message number?  (Or if you have a copy of the message and could
messages.messageBody:
> Below is a post from
> http://hajime3.hp.infoseek.co.jp/cgi-bin/bbs_06/bbs_06.cgi

......

> ***If someone would like to try giving us a clear translation
> please post (^_^)

I might be able to give it a try if I could find the original post. Do you
know the message number? (Or if you have a copy of the message and could
e-mail it to me directly without going through Yahoo, that would work too.
Unfortunately, Yahoo doesn't support Japanese characters.)



(No guarantees on how well I can translate it, though. I'm still a beginner
at Japanese. I can usually puzzle out a few short paragraphs like this
between what I know and what I can look up in a dictionary, but I can't read
it well enough to go through the message board and find this one. My
reading in Japanese is still too slow and laborious for me to have much
patience for finding stuff.)



Niwashi

messages.subject: Yamaguchi Jiro (Saitou Hajime) and Saigo Tanomo
messages.msgSnippet: Below is a post from http://hajime3.hp.infoseek.co.jp/cgi-bin/bbs_06/bbs_06.cgi no text is cited (as far as I can tell) the topic discussed is the Shinsengumi
messages.messageBody:
Below is a post from
http://hajime3.hp.infoseek.co.jp/cgi-bin/bbs_06/bbs_06.cgi
no text is cited (as far as I can tell)

the topic discussed is the Shinsengumi [after] Kyoto that is when
some of them ended up in Aizu. It is not clear if Hijikata Toshizo
is still in Aizu or not. All that we know is that after Hijikata
left Aizu with a large group (including Nakajima Nobori) -perhaps-
to find reinforcements, Saitou (now known as Yamaguchi Jiro) stayed
behind in Aizu with just a handful of men.

"Saigo Tanomo" mentioned was a very important retainer close to
Matsudaira Katamori (daimyo of Aizu).

***If someone would like to try giving us a clear translation please
post (^_^)
